centre_control.title: Controlling the Centre
description: The centre of the board is the region in which pieces are typically at their
It affords the most mobility and coverage, due to limiting the maximum distance
to any other part of the board. A bishop placed in the centre can see to all four corners,
and a knight will not have its movement blocked by the edges of the board.
These benefits make the centre a
stronghold, and much of opening theory is dedicated to fighting for control of it.
